name: Sex Discrimination Act 1984
description: Australian federal law that makes it illegal to discriminate against a person on the grounds of breastfeeding.
troubleshooting: If you receive a complaint from a customer you may advise them that this is a women's right under Australian Federal Law.
If you are uncomfortable, unsure, or if the complaint escalates seek help from your Store Manager.
constraints: In Australian Federal Law, breastfeeding is a right, not a privilege.
Under the federal Sex Discrimination Act 1984 it is illegal in Australia to discriminate against a person either directly or indirectly on the grounds of breastfeeding.
A woman has the right to breastfeed, or express milk, anywhere she chooses. This includes our stores.
bestPractice: Seek help from your Store Manager if you are unsure.
No one should ever be asked by a team member to cover themselves or stop breastfeeding or expressing anywhere in our stores.
